job_details.Functieomschrijving:
Being a Senior Engineer for ourDigital Employee Experience in the AH Retail Tech Platform, meansyou are responsible for all the back-end services of Albert Heijn'semployee app, called '@AH', used by more than 100.000employees.This app has many functionalities, like checking out theAH news, connecting to colleagues via chat, and view workschedules. But even more exciting there's much more on our roadmapfor the upcoming months and years, like GenAI, task management,digital onboarding and training, and scaling to new business unitsand other brands.

   As a passionate SeniorEngineer, you own the realization of new features. You lead theteam in keeping up the high security and coding standards of theplatform, push the engineering skills of the team, and develop newfeatures using the latesttechnology.

   Youparticipate in standups and refinements, develop code, enforce codequality, develop best practices, write tests and manage thecontinuous integration of code. As a Senior Engineer you supportproduct or platform architects and are the technical point ofcontact for product owners and heads of tech. Beyond your own team,you contribute to the AH Tech community via Guilds, inner sourceinitiatives, andmore.

   Morespecifically, as Senior Devops Engineeryou :
     * Are the Lead softwareengineer, guiding other back- and front-end developers indeveloping a feature-rich product for ouremployees.
     * Understand how to technically scalethe services in the 'employee experience platform', which empowersthe "@AH app".
     * Understand how to combine bestagile development practices in combination with a services-basedarchitecture.
     * Are an expert on 'your' domain(Kotlin back-end services on our Azure Kubernetes platform), thoughyou can also liaise with other senior engineers and theirrespective technologies (Front and BackEnd).

   Whywe believe this is a cooljob
     * You get to work withmodern technologies, and since this is a new-build solution we havezero legacy.
     * Everything we build in the app isscalable, using Azure and Microservices, Kubernetes, CI / CDpipelines. We work in small increments so we're able to put thingslive straight away, hence reduce our time tomarket.
     * We work in a multi-disciplinarian team;with dedicated QA, UX designer, developers, product owner. In totalthe team consists of 8+ people.
     * Thisinitiative, building an employee app for your own colleagues, is apriority project for Albert Heijn, with the potential of scaling toother brands within Ahold Delhaize.
     * As a Seniorengineer you have an impact on the direction of the (technical)part of the app. And the way we work in this project is a blueprintfor other teams in our Retail Tech Platform. Therefore, weencourage you to share knowledge and best practices with otherteams.
       Whatdo you bring
       At AH Technology you'll beworking for one of the biggest food retailers in the Netherlands.To be successful as our new senior back end engineer youbring
job_details.full_text:
Backend Developer

Being a Senior Engineer for ourDigital Employee Experience in the AH Retail Tech Platform, meansyou are responsible for all the back-end services of Albert Heijn'semployee app, called '@AH', used by more than 100.000employees.This app has many functionalities, like checking out theAH news, connecting to colleagues via chat, and view workschedules. But even more exciting there's much more on our roadmapfor the upcoming months and years, like GenAI, task management,digital onboarding and training, and scaling to new business unitsand other brands.

   As a passionate SeniorEngineer, you own the realization of new features. You lead theteam in keeping up the high security and coding standards of theplatform, push the engineering skills of the team, and develop newfeatures using the latesttechnology.

   Youparticipate in standups and refinements, develop code, enforce codequality, develop best practices, write tests and manage thecontinuous integration of code. As a Senior Engineer you supportproduct or platform architects and are the technical point ofcontact for product owners and heads of tech. Beyond your own team,you contribute to the AH Tech community via Guilds, inner sourceinitiatives, andmore.

   Morespecifically, as Senior Devops Engineeryou :
     * Are the Lead softwareengineer, guiding other back- and front-end developers indeveloping a feature-rich product for ouremployees.
     * Understand how to technically scalethe services in the 'employee experience platform', which empowersthe "@AH app".
     * Understand how to combine bestagile development practices in combination with a services-basedarchitecture.
     * Are an expert on 'your' domain(Kotlin back-end services on our Azure Kubernetes platform), thoughyou can also liaise with other senior engineers and theirrespective technologies (Front and BackEnd).

   Whywe believe this is a cooljob
     * You get to work withmodern technologies, and since this is a new-build solution we havezero legacy.
     * Everything we build in the app isscalable, using Azure and Microservices, Kubernetes, CI / CDpipelines. We work in small increments so we're able to put thingslive straight away, hence reduce our time tomarket.
     * We work in a multi-disciplinarian team;with dedicated QA, UX designer, developers, product owner. In totalthe team consists of 8+ people.
     * Thisinitiative, building an employee app for your own colleagues, is apriority project for Albert Heijn, with the potential of scaling toother brands within Ahold Delhaize.
     * As a Seniorengineer you have an impact on the direction of the (technical)part of the app. And the way we work in this project is a blueprintfor other teams in our Retail Tech Platform. Therefore, weencourage you to share knowledge and best practices with otherteams.
       Whatdo you bring
       At AH Technology you'll beworking for one of the biggest food retailers in the Netherlands.To be successful as our new senior back end engineer youbring

profile_classification.rationale: The job description focuses heavily on traditional backend software development, including API development, microservices, CI/CD, and Kotlin. While it mentions 'GenAI' as a future roadmap item, the core responsibilities and current technologies described do not align with the specialized skills of a GenAI Engineer or ML Engineer. The role is primarily about building and scaling backend services for an employee app, making it a general software engineering role rather than an AI-focused one.

job_tasks.justification: The description emphasizes building backend services, developing features, writing code, enforcing code quality, writing tests, and managing continuous integration, which are core software development activities.
job_tasks.phrase: responsible for all the back-end services

job_tasks.justification: The role involves owning the realization of new features and developing them using the latest technology, which is a key aspect of software development.
job_tasks.phrase: own the realization of new features

job_tasks.justification: The description details participation in standups and refinements, developing code, enforcing code quality, developing best practices, writing tests, and managing continuous integration, all standard software development practices.
job_tasks.phrase: participate in standups and refinements, develop code, enforce code quality, develop best practices, write tests and manage the continuous integration of code

job_tasks.justification: The role involves guiding other developers in building a feature-rich product, which is a lead software engineering responsibility.
job_tasks.phrase: Are the Lead software engineer, guiding other back- and front-end developers in developing a feature-rich product

job_tasks.justification: The description mentions combining agile development practices with a services-based architecture, which is a common approach in modern software development.
job_tasks.phrase: combine best agile development practices in combination with a services-based architecture

job_tasks.justification: The mention of 'DevOps Engineer' in the context of managing CI/CD pipelines, Azure Kubernetes platform, and scaling services points towards operations engineering responsibilities.
The job involves managing the continuous integration of code and working with CI/CD pipelines, which are key components of MLOps and DevOps.
job_tasks.phrase: manage the continuous integration of code

job_tasks.justification: The role requires scaling services technically and working with Azure Kubernetes platform, indicating infrastructure and deployment management.
job_tasks.phrase: technically scalethe services in the 'employee experience platform'

job_tasks.justification: The description explicitly mentions working with Azure, Microservices, Kubernetes, and CI/CD pipelines, all of which are core to operations engineering and MLOps.
job_tasks.phrase: using Azure and Microservices, Kubernetes, CI / CD pipelines

job_tasks.justification: The role is responsible for the employee app used by over 100,000 employees and has a roadmap including GenAI, task management, and digital onboarding, indicating a need to understand business needs and future strategic directions.
job_tasks.phrase: responsible for all the back-end services of Albert Heijn's employee app, called '@AH', used by more than 100.000 employees.

job_tasks.justification: The role involves being the technical point of contact for product owners and heads of tech, requiring an understanding of business requirements and strategic alignment.
job_tasks.phrase: technical point of contact for product owners and heads of tech

job_tasks.justification: The project is a priority for Albert Heijn with potential for scaling, and the work is a blueprint for other teams, indicating a need for business context and strategic impact.
job_tasks.phrase: This initiative, building an employee app for your own colleagues, is a priority project for Albert Heijn, with the potential of scaling to other brands within Ahold Delhaize.
